overview: Students will develop instrumental, vocal or conducting technique to a level appropriate to a fourth year of study and a sophisticated awareness of the stylistic and interpretative characteristics of the repertory studies. Students will also take a number of ensemble electives to expand their practical experience. Subjects in Music Language, Aural Studies and historical, cultural and contextual studies add breadth and depth to the musical studies.

Compulsory Subjects.MUSI40064: The Research Process for Musicians Credits

Compulsory Subjects: Students select one of the following:

Compulsory Subjects.MUSI10023: Music Language 1: the Diatonic World Credits

Elective Subjects: Students select 50 points of electives from the list ofGraduate Diploma in Music Electives.
